item.title: ‘South Park’ Global Fans Furious as Show Pulled From Paramount+ Amid Licensing Dispute
item.description: A lapsed streaming deal and the ongoing Paramount-Skydance merger review have left viewers outside the U.S. scrambling for access to the long-running animated hit, just ahead of its season 27 premiere

item.title: ‘South Park’ Removed From Paramount+ Outside the U.S.
item.description: Amid a streaming rights battle, the platform’s license to stream the series internationally has expired, sources tell The Hollywood Reporter.

item.title: What Will It Take to Get the Paramount-Skydance Deal Done?
item.description: A CBS News ombudsman? Ending DEI? Moving staff from New York to Pittsburgh?
